summary: This document provides a detailed profile of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining his career, net worth, and philanthropic efforts. It highlights his connections to various organizations and individuals, including his role as a financier and philanthropist, and mentions his notable clients and educational background.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is described as an American financier and philanthropist with an estimated net worth of $2 billion, known for funding educational programs and managing high-net-worth clients.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is mentioned as one of Epstein's biggest and publicly known clients, known for his role as the former chairman of the Limited chain of women's clothing stores.

connections.description: Leslie Wexner is noted as a significant client of Epstein's financial firm, indicating a professional relationship.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was born on January 20, 1953, in Brooklyn, New York.
He has an estimated net worth of $2 billion.
Epstein began his career at Bear Stearns in 1976 and later founded his own financial firm, J. Epstein & Co.
He is known for funding The Program for Evolutionary Dynamics at Harvard University.
Leslie Wexner is mentioned as one of Epstein's most notable clients.
